item.title: Beocord 5000 (4715/4716): Fader Fixed and Putting it Back Together
item.description:
I examined the fader on my Beocord 5000 (4715) tape deck and discovered significant corrosion on the Fade In and Fade Out button contacts, preventing them from making a connection. Using DeoxIT D100 applied to a strip of paper, I cleaned the contact pads while pressing the buttons. This successfully removed the corrosion, evidenced by black streaks on the paper. I repeated this process on the remaining buttons, restoring the deck’s responsiveness to a like-new condition...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beocord-5000-47154716-fader-fixed-and-putting-it-back-together/

item.title: Beocord 5000 (4715/4716): First Recordings!
item.description:
I connected my Beocord 5000 tape deck to my Beomaster 6000 receiver for testing. Using a Beogram 4004 turntable, I recorded a track from a 1970s Miles Davis record onto a TDK SA 90 cassette. Everything worked perfectly! The Beocord performed flawlessly, recording and playing back the track with excellent quality. The sound was almost identical to the source material, with just a touch more background noise (even with Dolby noise reduction enabled)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beocord-5000-47154716-first-recordings-/
